title.native: 七つの大罪 聖戦の予兆
title.romaji: Nanatsu no Taizai: Seisen no Shirushi
title.english: The Seven Deadly Sins: Signs of A Holy War

description: Four-part original story by mangaka Nakaba Suzuki. Having taken the kingdom of Leones back from Holy Knights, the Seven Deadly Sins, along with Elizabeth and Hawk, can finally enjoy peaceful lives they earned. However, with premonitions of a new threat looming, their happy, ordinary days are about to end.
synonyms: The Seven Deadly Sins: Signs of Holy War
The Seven Deadly Sins - Anzeichen eines Heiligen Kriegs
ศึกตำนาน 7 อัศวิน ภาค สัญญาณสงครามศักดิ์สิทธิ์
The Seven Deadly Sins: Ślady Świętej Wojny

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

title.native: 七つの大罪 戒めの復活

node.description:
[Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/suzukinakaba/)

Japanese manga artist who has published works in Weekly Shounen Jump, Weekly Shounen Sunday, and Weekly Shounen Magazine.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/insight001)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/unicococ)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sasakino00) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木啓悟F)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). 
Previously affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures). 
Currently affiliated with [CygamesPicture](https://anilist.co/studio/6182/CygamesPictures).

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**
Takafumi Wada is a Japanese Composer.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/344493581)
__Mike McFarland__ is an American voice actor, ADR Director, Script, and Line Producer at Funimation Entertainment.

MUCC is a japanese rock band formed in Ibaraki, Japan in 1997.  The band has four members: 逹瑯 (Tatsurou Iwakami, vocals) ミヤ (Masaaki Yaguchi, guitar) YUKKE (Yusuke Fukuno, bass SATOち (Satochi Takayasu, drums)  In 1997, ex-member Hiro was the bassist, replaced by YUKKE in 1999.  The band’s name, decided upon by guitarist ミヤ, was originally the name of a character from the Japanese children's program “Ponkickies.” The band is also known as "six-nine” from a play on words, since six-nine can be pronounced “muku” (六九) in Japanese. June 9th (6/9) is also known as “MUCC day” by their fans.  (Source: last.fm)

Though he was a Physics major at Chiba University, he joined an Anime Research Club that inspired him to enter the industry. He started as a Production Assistant affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures) and gradually moved to directorial roles.

Though he was a Physics major at Chiba University, he joined an Anime Research Club that inspired him to enter the industry. He started as a Production Assistant affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures) and gradually moved to directorial roles.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chororoles) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/chororoles/)

A Mexican voice actor. He is known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Mordecai in _Regular Show_ and James Gordon in _Gotham_.

He's the father of [Abril Gómez](https://anilist.co/staff/203264/Abril-Gmez).

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/jorgevasconcellosdub) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100091905272928)

Jorge José Vasconcellos Paulo is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, singer, and dubbing director.

In 2007 he won a Yamato Award for Best Supporting Voice Actor, as the voice of Principal Pixiefrog in the cartoon My Gym Partner's a Monkey.

__Non-Anime Roles:__

Pedro Lima Crispim Ribeiro, better known as Pedro Crispim, is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, and dubbing director. He is the son of voice actors [Fernanda Crispim](https://anilist.co/staff/191884/) and [Duda Ribeiro](https://anilist.co/staff/183844/), older brother of [Vitória Crispim](https://anilist.co/staff/175179/) and nephew of [Peterson Adriano](https://anilist.co/staff/102318/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Lucas Adams (Grey's Anatomy)
- Bilal Ibrahim (Elite)
- Conner Kent / Superboy (Reign of the Supermen)
- Chandler (MrBeast)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/dudaribeirodub) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/duda.ribeiro.507)

Eduardo Ribeiro, better known as Duda Ribeiro, is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, singer, and musician. He is also the cousin of the voice actor [Marco Ribeiro](https://anilist.co/staff/104532/), father of [Pedro Crispim](https://anilist.co/staff/180890/) and [Vitória Crispim](https://anilist.co/staff/175179/) and translator Eduarda Ribeiro.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
